Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Nourishment \Nour"ish*ment\, n. [Cf. OF. norrissement.] [1913 Webster] 1. The act of nourishing, or the state of being nourished; nutrition. [1913 Webster]
2. That which serves to nourish; nutriment; food. [1913 Webster]
Learn to seek the nourishment of their souls. --Hooker. [1913 Webster]

nourishment n 1: a source of materials to nourish the body [syn: {nutriment}, {nutrition}, {sustenance}, {aliment}, {alimentation}, {victuals}] 2: the act of nourishing; "her nourishment of the orphans saved many lives"
